Source catalogs¶

These functions retrieve and parse the SDSS, 2MASS, and Gaia DR1 catalogs to be used when fixing the WCS solutions of individual OTAs.

offlinecats.get_sdss_coords_offline(img, ota, inst, output='test.sdss')[source]¶

Pull out and parse the CAT.PHOTCALIB table from img header. This function will separate the SDSS stars in CAT.PHOTCALIB based on which ota they fall on.

Parameters:
  • img (str) – Name of image
  • ota (str) – Name of OTA
  • int (str) – Version of ODI used, podi or 5odi
Returns:

  • xdim (int) – Size of OTA in the x direction NAXIS1
  • ydim (int) – Size of OTA in the y direction NAXIS2

Note

If the images being processed do not fall in the SDSS footprint, the QuickReduce pipeline will use PanSTARRS. This function will still pull out these stars and treat them as SDSS stars. There will be no u magnitudes available, however.

offlinecats.get_2mass_coords_offline(img, ota, inst, output='test.mass')[source]¶

Pull out and parse the CAT.ODI+2MASS table from img header. This function will separate the 2MASS stars in CAT.ODI+2MASS based on which ota they fall on.

Parameters:
  • img (str) – Name of image
  • ota (str) – Name of OTA
  • int (str) – Version of ODI used, podi or 5odi
Returns:

  • xdim (int) – Size of OTA in the x direction NAXIS1
  • ydim (int) – Size of OTA in the y direction NAXIS2
offlinecats.get_gaia_coords(img, ota, inst, output='test.gaia', cluster=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Query the online Gaia DR1 based on the central coordinates of the current OTA. If the cluster flag is set to True, the querey will avoid a crowded region based on coordinates and a radius set by the user in the configuration files.

Parameters:
  • img (str) – Name of image
  • ota (str) – Name of OTA
  • int (str) – Version of ODI used, podi or 5odi
